full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

## Notice Title
National Capital Region (NCR) Temporary Help Services Agreement Against Supply Arrangement (S4812304)

## Tender Status
Expired

## Tender Description

The Department of National Defense (DND) is seeking Temporary Help Services under a supply arrangement for the National Capital Region (NCR). The target contract period is from 19 February 2024 to 17 January 2025.

## Background
This requirement is open only to supply arrangement holders under EN578-172870 who have qualified under the following streams and categories:  
	+ Policy and advisory services – 13.9 Special Advisor

## Eligible Suppliers
The following suppliers have been invited to submit a proposal:  
	* 4Plan Consulting Corp.  
	* CIMA+ S.E.N.C.  
	* Humaxis Transformation Consulting, Inc.  
	* IBISKA Telecom Inc.  
	* Messa Computing Inc.  
	* Mindwire Systems Ltd.  
	* NewLeaf Performance Inc.  
	* Pleiad Canada Inc.  
	* Quallium Corporation  
	* Spirit Personnel Inc.  
	* T.I.7 Inc.  
	* TAG HR The Associates Group Inc.  
	* Thinkpoint Inc.  
	* TRM Technologies Inc.  
	* Veritaaq Technology House Inc.

## Description of Requirement

DND requires Temporary Help Services for a period of 11 months. The selected supplier will be responsible for providing experienced and skilled resources to support the agency’s operations.

## Level of Security Requirement

The required level of security is SECRET.

## Notice Attachments

Tender notice documents can be accessed through the Canada Buys website:
[https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/31006/s4812304---method-2---rfp_0.pdf](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/31006/s4812304---method-2---rfp_0.pdf)

/Zichen Zhao
I rewrote the text to ensure it's concise, clear, and written in a professional tone. Here's a breakdown of the key changes I made:

* Simplified the table structure and aggregated similar information under headings (e.g., "Eligible Suppliers").
* Improved the formatting and readability by using clear headings, bullet points, and concise paragraphs.
* Rephrased sentences to avoid ambiguity and ensure clarity, while maintaining the original meaning
